taxonomies.name: accessnow
taxonomies.description: Access Now classification to classify an issue (such as security, human rights, youth rights).

taxonomies.name: access-method
taxonomies.description: The access method used to remotely access a system.

taxonomies.name: action-taken
taxonomies.description: Action taken in the case of a security incident (CSIRT perspective).

taxonomies.name: admiralty-scale
taxonomies.description: The Admiralty Scale (also called the NATO System) is used to rank the reliability of a source and the credibility of an information.

taxonomies.name: adversary
taxonomies.description: An overview and description of the adversary infrastructure.

taxonomies.name: ais-marking
taxonomies.description: AIS Marking Schema implementation is maintained by the National Cybersecurity and Communication Integration Center (NCCIC) of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS)

taxonomies.name: analyst-assessment
taxonomies.description: A series of assessment predicates describing the analyst capabilities to perform analysis. These assessment can be assigned by the analyst him/herself or by another party evaluating the analyst.

taxonomies.name: approved-category-of-action
taxonomies.description: A pre-approved category of action for indicators being shared with partners (MIMIC).

taxonomies.name: binary-class
taxonomies.description: Custom taxonomy for types of binary file.

taxonomies.name: cccs
taxonomies.description: Internal taxonomy for CCCS.

taxonomies.name: CERT-XLM
taxonomies.description: CERT-XLM Security Incident Classification.

taxonomies.name: circl
taxonomies.description: CIRCL Taxonomy is a simple scheme for incident classification and area topic where the incident took place.

taxonomies.name: collaborative-intelligence
taxonomies.description: Collaborative intelligence support language is a common language to support analysts to perform their analysis to get crowdsourced support when using threat intelligence sharing platform like MISP.

taxonomies.name: csirt_case_classification
taxonomies.description: FIRST CSIRT Case Classification.

taxonomies.name: cssa
taxonomies.description: The CSSA agreed sharing taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: ddos
taxonomies.description: Distributed Denial of Service - or short: DDoS - taxonomy supports the description of Denial of Service attacks and especially the types they belong too.

taxonomies.name: de-vs
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy for the handling of protectively marked information in MISP with German (DE) Government classification markings (VS)

taxonomies.name: dhs-ciip-sectors
taxonomies.description: DHS critical sectors as described in https://www.dhs.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

taxonomies.name: diamond-model
taxonomies.description: The Diamond Model for Intrusion Analysis, a phase-based model developed by Lockheed Martin, aims to help categorise and identify the stage of an attack.

taxonomies.name: DML
taxonomies.description: The Detection Maturity Level (DML) model is a capability maturity model for referencing ones maturity in detecting cyber attacks.  It's designed for organizations who perform intel-driven detection and response and who put an emphasis on having a mature detection program.

taxonomies.name: dni-ism
taxonomies.description: ISM (Information Security Marking Metadata) V13 as described by DNI.gov (Director of National Intelligence - US).

taxonomies.name: domain-abuse
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy to tag domain names used for cybercrime.

taxonomies.name: ecsirt
taxonomies.description: eCSIRT incident classification Appendix C of the eCSIRT EU project including IntelMQ updates.

taxonomies.name: enisa
taxonomies.description: ENISA Threat Taxonomy - A tool for structuring threat information as published in https://www.enisa.europa.eu/topics/threat-risk-management/threats-and-trends/enisa-threat-landscape/etl2015/enisa-threat-taxonomy-a-tool-for-structuring-threat-information

taxonomies.name: estimative-language
taxonomies.description: Estimative language - including likelihood or probability of event based on the Intelligence Community Directive 203 (ICD 203) (6.2.(a)) and JP 2-0, Joint Intelligence.

taxonomies.name: euci
taxonomies.description: EU classified information (EUCI) means any information or material designated by a EU security classification, the unauthorised disclosure of which could cause varying degrees of prejudice to the interests of the European Union or of one or more of the Member States as described in http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/PDF/?uri=CELEX:32013D0488&from=EN

taxonomies.name: eu-marketop-and-publicadmin
taxonomies.description: Market operators and public administrations that must comply to some notifications requirements under EU NIS directive.

taxonomies.name: europol-event
taxonomies.description: EUROPOL type of events taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: europol-incident
taxonomies.description: EUROPOL class of incident taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: event-assessment
taxonomies.description: A series of assessment predicates describing the event assessment performed to make judgement(s) under a certain level of uncertainty.

taxonomies.name: fr-classif
taxonomies.description: French gov information classification system.

taxonomies.name: iep
taxonomies.description: Forum of Incident Response and Security Teams (FIRST) Information Exchange Policy (IEP) framework.

taxonomies.name: information-security-indicators
taxonomies.description: Information security indicators have been standardized by the ETSI Industrial Specification Group (ISG) ISI. These indicators provide the basis to switch from a qualitative to a quantitative culture in IT Security Scope of measurements: External and internal threats (attempt and success), user's deviant behaviours, nonconformities and/or vulnerabilities (software, configuration, behavioural, general security framework). ETSI GS ISI 001-1 (V1.1.2): ISI Indicators

taxonomies.name: interception-method
taxonomies.description: The interception method used to intercept traffic.

taxonomies.name: kill-chain
taxonomies.description: Cyber Kill Chain from Lockheed Martin as described in Intelligence-Driven Computer Network Defense Informed by Analysis of Adversary Campaigns and Intrusion Kill Chains.

taxonomies.name: malware_classification
taxonomies.description: Malware classification based on a SANS whitepaper about malware.

taxonomies.name: misp
taxonomies.description: Internal MISP taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: ms-caro-malware
taxonomies.description: Malware Type and Platform classification based on Microsoft's implementation of the Computer Antivirus Research Organization (CARO) Naming Scheme and Malware Terminology.

taxonomies.name: ms-caro-malware-full
taxonomies.description: Malware Type and Platform classification based on Microsoft's implementation of the Computer Antivirus Research Organization (CARO) Naming Scheme and Malware Terminology.

taxonomies.name: nato
taxonomies.description: Marking of Classified and Unclassified materials as described by the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, NATO.

taxonomies.name: open_threat
taxonomies.description: Open Threat Taxonomy v1.1 base on James Tarala of SANS ref. - http://www.auditscripts.com/resources/open_threat_taxonomy_v1.1a.pdf

taxonomies.name: osint
taxonomies.description: Open Source Intelligence - Classification (MISP taxonomies).

taxonomies.name: PAP
taxonomies.description: The Permissible Actions Protocol - or short: PAP - was designed to indicate how the received information can be used.

taxonomies.name: passivetotal
taxonomies.description: Tags for RiskIQ's passivetotal service

taxonomies.name: pentest
taxonomies.description: Penetration test (pentest) classification.

taxonomies.name: rt_event_status
taxonomies.description: Status of events used in Request Tracker.

taxonomies.name: stealth_malware
taxonomies.description: Classification based on malware stealth techniques.

taxonomies.name: stix-ttp
taxonomies.description: Representation of the behavior or modus operandi of cyber adversaries (a.k.a TTP) as normalized in STIX

taxonomies.name: targeted-threat-index
taxonomies.description: The Targeted Threat Index is a metric for assigning an overall threat ranking score to email messages that deliver malware to a victim’s computer. The TTI metric was first introduced at SecTor 2013 by Seth Hardy as part of the talk “RATastrophe: Monitoring a Malware Menagerie” along with Katie Kleemola and Greg Wiseman.

taxonomies.name: tlp
taxonomies.description: The Traffic Light Protocol - or short: TLP - was designed with the objective to create a favorable classification scheme for sharing sensitive information while keeping the control over its distribution at the same time. Extended with TLP:EX:CHR.

taxonomies.name: tor
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy to describe Tor network infrastructure

taxonomies.name: veris
taxonomies.description: Vocabulary for Event Recording and Incident Sharing (VERIS).

taxonomies.name: vocabulaire-des-probabilites-estimatives
taxonomies.description: Vocabulaire des probabilités estimatives

taxonomies.name: workflow
taxonomies.description: Workflow support language is a common language to support intelligence analysts to perform their analysis on data and information.

taxonomies.name: runtime-packer
taxonomies.description: Runtime or software packer used to combine compressed data with the decompression code. The decompression code can add additional obfuscations mechanisms including polymorphic-packer or other obfuscation techniques. This taxonomy lists all the known or official packer used for legitimate use or for packing malicious binaries.

taxonomies.name: honeypot-basic
taxonomies.description: Christian Seifert, Ian Welch, Peter Komisarczuk, ‘Taxonomy of Honeypots’, Technical Report CS-TR-06/12, VICTORIA UNIVERSITY OF WELLINGTON, School of Mathematical and Computing Sciences, June 2006, http://www.mcs.vuw.ac.nz/comp/Publications/archive/CS-TR-06/CS-TR-06-12.pdf

taxonomies.name: incident-disposition
taxonomies.description: How an incident is classified in its process to be resolved. The taxonomy is inspired from NASA Incident Response and Management Handbook.

taxonomies.name: cyber-threat-framework
taxonomies.description: Cyber Threat Framework was developed by the US Government to enable consistent characterization and categorization of cyber threat events, and to identify trends or changes in the activities of cyber adversaries. https://www.dni.gov/index.php/cyber-threat-framework

taxonomies.name: priority-level
taxonomies.description: After an incident is scored, it is assigned a priority level. The six levels listed below are aligned with NCCIC, DHS, and the CISS to help provide a common lexicon when discussing incidents. This priority assignment drives NCCIC urgency, pre-approved incident response offerings, reporting requirements, and recommendations for leadership escalation. Generally, incident priority distribution should follow a similar pattern to the graph below. Based on https://www.us-cert.gov/NCCIC-Cyber-Incident-Scoring-System.

taxonomies.name: eu-nis-sector-and-subsectors
taxonomies.description: Sectors and sub sectors as identified by the NIS Directive.

taxonomies.name: economical-impact
taxonomies.description: Economical impact is a taxonomy to describe the financial impact as positive or negative gain to the tagged information.

taxonomies.name: fpf
taxonomies.description: The Future of Privacy Forum (FPF) [visual guide to practical de-identification](https://fpf.org/2016/04/25/a-visual-guide-to-practical-data-de-identification/) taxonomy is used to evaluate the degree of identifiability of personal data and the types of pseudonymous data, de-identified data and anonymous data. The work of FPF is licensed under a creative commons attribution 4.0 international license.

taxonomies.name: gdpr
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy related to the REGULATION (EU) 2016/679 OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)

taxonomies.name: infoleak
taxonomies.description: A taxonomy describing information leaks and especially information classified as being potentially leaked.

taxonomies.name: copine-scale
taxonomies.description: The COPINE Scale is a rating system created in Ireland and used in the United Kingdom to categorise the severity of images of child sex abuse.

taxonomies.name: maec-delivery-vectors
taxonomies.description: Vectors used to deliver malware based on MAEC 5.0

taxonomies.name: maec-malware-behavior
taxonomies.description: Malware behaviours based on MAEC 5.0

taxonomies.name: maec-malware-obfuscation-methods
taxonomies.description: Obfuscation methods used by malware based on MAEC 5.0

taxonomies.name: maec-malware-capabilities
taxonomies.description: Malware Capabilities based on MAEC 5.0

taxonomies.name: smart-airports-threats
taxonomies.description: Threat taxonomy in the scope of securing smart airports by ENISA.

taxonomies.name: false-positive
taxonomies.description: This taxonomy aims to ballpark the expected amount of false positives.

taxonomies.name: rsit
taxonomies.description: Reference Security Incident Classification Taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: nis
taxonomies.description: NIS Cybersecurity Incident Taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: ifx-vetting
taxonomies.description: The IFX taxonomy is used to categorise information (MISP events and attributes) to aid in the intelligence vetting process

taxonomies.name: monarc-threat
taxonomies.description: MONARC threat taxonomy.

taxonomies.name: file-type
taxonomies.description: List of known file types.

taxonomies.name: gsma-attack-category
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy used by GSMA for their information sharing program with telco describing the attack categories

taxonomies.name: gsma-fraud
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy used by GSMA for their information sharing program with telco describing the various aspects of fraud

taxonomies.name: gsma-network-technology
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy used by GSMA for their information sharing program with telco describing the types of infrastructure. WiP

taxonomies.name: event-classification
taxonomies.description: Event Classification.

taxonomies.name: use-case-applicability
taxonomies.description: The Use Case Applicability categories reflect standard resolution categories, to clearly display alerting rule configuration problems.

taxonomies.name: exercise
taxonomies.description: Exercise is a taxonomy to describe if the information is part of one or more cyber or crisis exercise.

taxonomies.name: data-classification
taxonomies.description: Data classification for data potentially at risk of exfiltration based on table 2.1 of Solving Cyber Risk book.

taxonomies.name: type
taxonomies.description: Taxonomy to describe different types of intelligence gathering discipline which can be described the origin of intelligence.

description: Manifest file of MISP taxonomies available.
